item.title: The top 15 rappers in Multisyllabic Rhyming
item.description:
The top 15 rappers in Multisyllabic Rhyming

Not just based on these songs. This list was harder to create then what i thought, when you take into consideration the amount of mc's that could push for the last few spots.

item.title: Rapping, deconstructed: The best rhymers of all time
item.description:
Rapping, deconstructed: The best rhymers of all time

Here's how some of the greatest rappers make rhymes Special thanks to the research of Martin Connor who was interviewed in this piece. More of his rap analysis can be found here: http://www.rapanalysis.com/ SPOTIFY PLAYLIST: https://open.spotify.com/user/estellecaswell/playlist/5KpHR1UysAms2zssDHeSbZ Subscribe to our channel!

item.title: Graffiti documentary (Full)

Graffiti documentary (Full)

the beatifull and the ugly side of graffiti and street art a must watch for every enthousiast

item.title: Microphone Check
item.description:
Microphone Check

Conversations with hip-hop legends and rising talents, hosted by Ali Shaheed Muhammad, DJ, producer and one-third of the legendary group A Tribe Called Quest, and NPR Music editor Frannie Kelley.

item.title: Reservation Rap Trailer | VICE | United States
item.description:
Reservation Rap Trailer | VICE | United States

In episode 1 of The Score, we delve into Minnesota's Native American hip hop scene, where members of the Ojibwe tribe are fusing stories of struggle and indigenous consciousness to create a unique sound and a wholly modern native identity. .

item.title: Ron Finley: A guerilla gardener in South Central LA
item.description:
Ron Finley: A guerilla gardener in South Central LA

Ron Finley plants vegetable gardens in South Central LA -- in abandoned lots, traffic medians, along the curbs. Why? For fun, for defiance, for beauty and to offer some alternative to fast food in a community where "the drive-thrus are killing more people than the drive-bys."

item.title: The art of rap Part II
item.description:
The art of rap Part II

SOMETHING FROM NOTHING: THE ART OF RAP is a feature length performance documentary about the runaway juggernaut that is Rap music. At the wheel of this unstoppable beast is the film's director and interviewer Ice-T. Taking us on a deeply personal journey Ice-T uncovers how this music of the street has grown to dominate the world.

item.title: Something from Nothing: The Art of Rap (2012) Part I
item.description:
Something from Nothing: The Art of Rap (2012) Part I

SOMETHING FROM NOTHING: THE ART OF RAP is a feature length performance documentary about the runaway juggernaut that is Rap music. At the wheel of this unstoppable beast is the film's director and interviewer Ice-T. Taking us on a deeply personal journey Ice-T uncovers how this music of the street has grown to dominate the world.

item.title: What Ever Happened to Hip Hop (Documentary)
item.description:
What Ever Happened to Hip Hop (Documentary)

Documentary from Sonali Aggarwal: Starring Afrika Bambaataa, KRS-ONE, Busy Bee, Kool Keith, MC Lyte, Slick Rick, Jean Grae, Gemini and other notable people being part of the Hip Hop movement. It began with the beat of the drum. With the beat, came a voice for those without one.
